abstract: Bank of America reached an agreement Monday to pay the United States $425 million to exit a costly arrangement where the government would have shouldered losses on risky assets from the bank’s takeover of Merrill Lynch.
snippet: Bank of America reached an agreement Monday to pay the United States $425 million to exit a costly arrangement where the government would have shouldered losses on risky assets from the bank’s takeover of Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America reached an agreement Monday to pay the United States $425 million to exit a costly arrangement in which the government would have shouldered losses on risky assets from the bank’s takeover of Merrill Lynch, The Associated Press reported.

headline.main: Bank of America to End Loss-Sharing Pact With U.S.
